intro: Scabiosa delminiana, commonly known as the Delminian scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Scabiosa delminiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
